climbs.name: Who Stole the Holds Off of the World's Hardest 5.2?

content.description: Physical yet thought provoking moves leads to fun rambly climbing in a great position.
content.protection: bolts to chain anchor. (There is access chains over the top, and it's easy to clip spider baby anchors instead.)
content.location: Obvious right trending bolt route on the south facing wall at the East end of Laclede.

content.description: Fun vertical wall near an arete with some tough/balancy moves down low before the climbing eases up near the chains.
content.protection: Mixed route with a few options to use a set of nuts.  Chains at the top.
content.location: Located between the crack and the arete on the western side of the wall around the corner from the rest of the routes.

content.description: Surprisingly challenging yet fun moves lead to a bouldery headwall mid route. The route was put up in February out of frustration with the lack of snow and ice in the mountains.
content.location: Directly up the South facing wall off of the ledge that ends at the routes spider baby and Jensen's dihedral.
